review_title: Busy Hospital with a great nursing team
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Corona, CA
pros: Flexible schedule 3/12s with benefits.
cons: Pay was decent for a CNA and many travel nurses

pros: Awesome director and co workers. Staffing ratio to patient is so much better than where I came from. Hospital contributes to your 401k if you open one unlike many other places. Management willing to work with employees who need extra support. Much better pay than many other places. Good hours and lots of hiring and promotion for all minorities. Variety of employee backgrounds and ages, from new grads to an employee still working at the age of 84! (And still functional!)
cons: The hospital could improve the overall culture by setting goals and involving staff in achieving those goals. Better processes for communicating from Corporate and Management to the employees. Also the hospital seems to still use an older model of the Doctors role there. Management could benefit by encouraging older Doctors to update their skill set and to keep current with new technology. Opening the cafeteria on weekends for employees at the rehab center.

pros: The hospital is moving to open our Bigger better ER which is great. I love working with a hospital that's very family oriented everyone knows each other and smile with the best foot forward. Working in the Surgery Department is great love my work family. Benefits are good. Its moving to be a staple in the City of Corona.
cons: Well Human Resources is horrible when it comes to help us out with issues they look like they dear with headlights, no communication at all they give us the run around. The cafeteria needs to offer us the night shift crew at least the salad bar or open up the grill. We dislike that the food taste like its been sitting out for a while or its uncooked. I think fair is fair treat your morning and evening shifts the same. Parking here is horrible. Sedgwick that company has to go they are a pain in a lot of the employees behind. They promise too much and don't deliver.

pros: Great people and hard working coworkers
cons: Horrible place to work and to be

review_title: Good place to work if you have another job.
pros:
1. Extremely flexible scheduling in most departments and units.
2. Non-Union, management is friendlier and more approachable.
3. Slower paced hospital, great for new grads or older nurses.
4. Most employees live in the area they dont commute which means buying lunch is easy, everyone knows where to go.
5. Everyone is very pleasant, no grouchy or sour nurses or hospital staff.
cons:
1. Bottom tier in terms of pay and compensation, right next to Parkview, for the West Riverside County area.  RCH, RUHSMC, and TVMC all pay more.
2. Non-Union - poor compensation, and be prepared to have no one watching your back if you get in trouble. Its a very cutthroat environment.
3. Financial/spending priorities are off track with what employees desire i.e. new ER built but pay has remained stagnant.
4. Employee retention isstagnant new grads come here and leave after about a year sometimes even just a few months.   Poor base pay and just 3% merit increases annually which are based on performance.  Annual evals are usually completed by someone you have only worked with a few times.
5. Many older physician's they can be quite degrading.

pros: CNA and secretary usually available on the floor.
cons: Poor communication and disconnect between nurses and management. Centered almost completely around patient satisfaction/customer service and profit, employee satisfaction and patient safety are of secondary concern. High RN turnover rate, mostly new grads on the floor.

review_title: Poor management, OR sterile supply issues, travel nurses staffing O.R & PACU. Nurses Union voted in, not  acknowledged.
pros:
Apparently OB has won some type of award a 
few years  in a row. Not a trauma center.
cons: Hospitalist haven't followed pt's closely. Poor communication between physicians and surgeons,  out of range labs often not corrected, pt's often not worked up appropriately or cleared for surgery but still sent to the O.R. then procedures usually cancelled,  delaying surgery intervention and hospital stays.

job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist in La Puente, CA
pros: Small hospital allows employees to know all hospital staff. This results in better patient satisfaction scores. Brand new ER is gorgeous!
cons: Cafeteria is not open throughout the night. You do not even have access to sandwiches in the middle of the night.
